feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:06AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated water levels along the West Coast Sunday and Monday... A strong weather system moving to the West Coast will bring elevated water levels to the coast south of the Bering Strait Sunday night and Monday and north of the Bering Strait on Monday. Water levels are expected to be 3 to 6 feet above the normal high tide line. Water levels will be similar to the system that brought
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:48AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICY SPOTS POSSIBLE ON UNTREATED SURFACES THIS MORNING... The combination of snow, ice and rain from yesterday into last night and below freezing temperatures may result in some icy spots on untreated surfaces early this morning. Drivers are urged to use caution this morning and be aware for potential slippery travel conditions.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued December 19 at 4:35AM EST until December 20 at 12:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Walton, Bay, Gulf, and Franklin County Beaches. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 17 at 8:54AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLD WEATHER WILL CAUSE ICE FORMATION ON THE MISSOURI RIVER... With another stretch of cold temperatures in store through the weekend and into next week, the Missouri River is making another attempt to initiate ice along the Burleigh and Morton counties reach of the river. Ice sheets are moving through the Bismarck and Mandan area of the river. What is uncertain is whether or not these ice

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.

entry.summary: ...Areas of dense fog creating hazardous driving conditions... Expect areas of dense fog to continue through through Sunday morning. Please use caution if having to travel.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 3:22AM PST until December 19 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches. * WHERE...South Washington Cascade Foothills, primarily south of Lake Merwin. * WHEN...Until noon PST today.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 3:22AM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 3:22AM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches near river level, with 6 to 12 inches above 500 feet. * WHERE...Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...Until noon PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:24AM PST until December 19 at 8:09PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River will continue to recede today. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING...

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 2:16AM PST until December 20 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches mainly above 3000 feet. * WHERE...Mountain Road, Anatone, Peola, and Cloverland Road. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 2:16AM PST until December 20 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches. * WHERE...Colfax, Rosalia, Tekoa, Uniontown, Pullman, and Oakesdale. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Wet and heavy snow will make driving on unplowed roads difficult.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 2:16AM PST until December 20 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected Above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches. * WHERE...Alpowa Summit and Pomeroy. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:36AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Southwest Winds Today... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...West to southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts 45 to 55 mph. * WHERE...The Cody Foothills near Clark.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 19 at 2:26AM MST until December 19 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 50 MPH with gusts up to 65 MPH possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 19 at 2:26AM MST until December 19 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
